00.name: The Fool
00.description: With light step, as if earth and its trammels had little power to restrain him, a young man in gorgeous vestments pauses at the brink of a precipice among the great heights of the world; he surveys the blue distance before him-its expanse of sky rather than the prospect below. His act of eager walking is still indicated, though he is stationary at the given moment; his dog is still bounding. The edge which opens on the depth has no terror; it is as if angels were waiting to uphold him, if it came about that he leaped from the height. His countenance is full of intelligence and expectant dream. He has a rose in one hand and in the other a costly wand, from which depends over his right shoulder a wallet curiously embroidered. He is a prince of the other world on his travels through this one.
00.interpretation: Folly, mania, extravagance, intoxication, delirium, frenzy, bewrayment. Reversed: Negligence, absence, distribution, carelessness, apathy, nullity, vanity.

upright.related: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, free spirit
upright.behavior: Taking risks, being spontaneous, following your heart
upright.meaning: A new beginning or adventure awaits. Trust your instincts and take a leap of faith
upright.sexuality: Playful and carefree approach to relationships
upright.marriage: Fresh start in relationships, taking chances in love

reversed.meaning: Consider your actions more carefully. You may be taking unnecessary risks
reversed.marriage: Need for more careful consideration in relationships

01.name: The Magician
01.description: A youthful figure in the robe of a magician, having the countenance of divine Apollo, with smile of confidence and shining eyes. Above his head is the mysterious sign of the Holy Spirit, the sign of life, like an endless cord, forming the figure 8 in a horizontal position. About his waist is a serpent-cincture, the serpent appearing to devour its own tail. This is familiar to most as a conventional symbol of eternity. In the Magician's right hand is a wand raised towards heaven, while the left hand is pointing to the earth. On the table in front of the Magician are the symbols of the four Tarot suits, signifying the elements of natural life.
01.interpretation: Skill, diplomacy, address, subtlety; sickness, pain, loss, disaster, snares of enemies; self-confidence, will. Reversed: Physician, Magus, mental disease, disgrace, disquiet.

upright.behavior: Using your skills and resources effectively
upright.meaning: You have all the tools you need to succeed. Take inspired action

reversed.behavior: Manipulating others, not using your talents
reversed.meaning: Be careful of manipulation. You may not be using your talents effectively

02.name: The High Priestess
02.description: She has the lunar crescent at her feet, a horned diadem on her head, with a globe in the middle place, and a large solar cross on her breast. The scroll in her hands is inscribed with the word Tora. She is seated between the white and black pillars of the mystic Temple, and the veil of the Temple is behind her: it is embroidered with palms and pomegranates. The vestments are flowing and gauzy, and the mantle suggests light--a shimmering radiance.
02.interpretation: Secrets, mystery, the future as yet unrevealed; silence, tenacity; mystery, wisdom, science. Reversed: Passion, moral or physical ardour, conceit, surface knowledge.

upright.behavior: Trusting your intuition, seeking inner wisdom
upright.meaning: Listen to your inner voice. Your intuition holds the answers you seek
upright.marriage: Understanding partner on a deeper level

reversed.related: Secrets, disconnection from intuition, hidden agendas
reversed.meaning: You may be overlooking your inner wisdom or hiding important truths
reversed.marriage: Hidden aspects in relationship need addressing

03.name: The Empress
03.description: A stately figure, seated, having rich vestments and royal aspect, as of a daughter of heaven and earth. Her diadem is of twelve stars, gathered in a cluster. The symbol of Venus is on the shield which rests near her. A field of corn is ripening in front of her, and beyond there is a fall of water. The sceptre which she bears is surmounted by the globe of this world.
03.interpretation: Fruitfulness, action, initiative, length of days; the unknown, clandestine; also difficulty, doubt, ignorance. Reversed: Light, truth, the unravelling of involved matters, public rejoicings; according to another reading, vacillation.

upright.meaning: A time of growth and abundance. Nurture your projects and relationships

reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing creative blocks or being too dependent

04.name: The Emperor
04.description: He has a form of the Crux ansata for his sceptre and a globe in his left hand. He is a crowned monarch--commanding, stately, seated on a throne, the arms of which are fronted by rams' heads. He is executive and realization, the power of this world, here clothed with the highest of its natural attributes.
04.interpretation: Stability, power, protection, realization; a great person; aid, reason, conviction; also authority and will. Reversed: Benevolence, compassion, credit; also confusion to enemies, obstruction, immaturity.

upright.meaning: Time to establish structure and take control of your situation

reversed.meaning: Be careful of being too rigid or authoritarian

05.name: The Hierophant
05.description: He wears the triple crown and is seated between two pillars, but they are not those of the Temple which is guarded by the High Priestess. In his left hand he holds a sceptre terminating in the triple cross, and with his right hand he gives the well-known ecclesiastical sign which is called that of esotericism. At his feet are the crossed keys, and two priestly ministers in albs kneel before him.
05.interpretation: Marriage, alliance, captivity, servitude; by another account, mercy and goodness; inspiration; the man to whom the Querent has recourse. Reversed: Society, good understanding, concord, overkindness, weakness.

upright.meaning: Consider traditional approaches or seek guidance from a mentor

reversed.meaning: You may need to challenge conventional wisdom

06.name: The Lovers
06.description: The sun shines in the zenith, and beneath is a great winged figure with arms extended, pouring down influences. In the foreground are two human figures, male and female, unveiled before each other, as if Adam and Eve when they first occupied the paradise of the earthly body. Behind the man is the Tree of Life, bearing twelve fruits, and the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil is behind the woman; the serpent is twining round it.
06.interpretation: Attraction, love, beauty, trials overcome. Reversed: Failure, foolish designs. Another account speaks of marriage frustrated and contrarieties of all kinds.

upright.meaning: A significant choice about love or partnership awaits

reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing relationship conflicts or avoiding important decisions

07.name: The Chariot
07.description: An erect and princely figure carrying a drawn sword and corresponding, broadly speaking, to the traditional description. On the shoulders of the victorious hero are supposed to be the Urim and Thummim. He has led captivity captive; he is conquest on all planes--in the mind, in science, in progress, in certain trials of initiation.
07.interpretation: Succour, providence also war, triumph, presumption, vengeance, trouble. Reversed: Riot, quarrel, dispute, litigation, defeat.

upright.behavior: Taking control, moving forward with confidence
upright.meaning: Success through determination and self-control

reversed.meaning: You may be lacking direction or losing control of your situation
reversed.marriage: Need to regain control of relationship direction

08.name: Strength
08.description: A woman, over whose head there broods the same symbol of life which we have seen in the card of the Magician, is closing the jaws of a lion. Her beneficent fortitude has already subdued the lion, which is being led by a chain of flowers. The only point in which this design differs from the conventional presentations is that her beneficent fortitude has already subdued the lion.
08.interpretation: Power, energy, action, courage, magnanimity; also complete success and honours. Reversed: Despotism, abuse if power, weakness, discord, sometimes even disgrace.

upright.meaning: Your inner strength and patience will help you overcome challenges

reversed.meaning: You may need to work on your self-confidence and inner strength

09.name: The Hermit
09.description: The variation from the conventional models in this card is only that the lamp is not enveloped partially in the mantle of its bearer, who blends the idea of the Ancient of Days with the Light of the World. It is a star which shines in the lantern. He is seen holding up his beacon on an eminence. Therefore the Hermit is not a wise man in search of truth and justice; his beacon intimates that 'where I am, you also may be'.
09.interpretation: Prudence, circumspection; also and especially treason, dissimulation, roguery, corruption. Reversed: Concealment, disguise, policy, fear, unreasoned caution.

upright.meaning: Take time for self-reflection and spiritual growth
upright.marriage: Need for personal space and reflection

reversed.meaning: Be careful of isolating yourself too much

10.name: Wheel of Fortune
10.description: In this symbol the wheel itself follows the indications of Eliphas Levi in respect of Ezekiel's vision. With the French occultist, and in the design itself, the symbolic picture stands for the perpetual motion of a fluidic universe and for the flux of human life. The Sphinx is the equilibrium therein. The transliteration of Taro as Rota is inscribed on the wheel.
10.interpretation: Destiny, fortune, success, elevation, luck, felicity. Reversed: Increase, abundance, superfluity.

upright.related: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, turning point
upright.meaning: A turning point brings positive change and good fortune

reversed.related: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles
reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing challenging changes or resisting necessary transitions

11.name: Justice
11.description: As this card follows the traditional symbolism and carries above all its obvious meanings, there is little to say regarding it. The figure is seated between pillars, like the High Priestess, and on this account it seems desirable to indicate that the moral principle which deals unto every man according to his works differs in its essence from the spiritual justice which is involved in the idea of election.
11.interpretation: Equity, rightness, probity, executive; triumph of the deserving side in law. Reversed: Law in all its departments, legal complications, bigotry, bias, excessive severity.

upright.related: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect
upright.meaning: Truth and justice will prevail. Fair decisions lead to balance

reversed.meaning: You may be facing or causing unfairness. Consider your actions' consequences

12.name: The Hanged Man
12.description: The gallows from which he is suspended forms a Tau cross, while the figure--from the position of the legs--forms a fylfot cross. There is a nimbus about the head of the seeming martyr. The tree of sacrifice is living wood, with leaves thereon; the face expresses deep entrancement, not suffering; the figure, as a whole, suggests life in suspension, but life and not death.
12.interpretation: Wisdom, circumspection, discernment, trials, sacrifice, intuition, divination, prophecy. Reversed: Selfishness, the crowd, body politic.

upright.related: Surrender, letting go, new perspective, sacrifice
upright.meaning: Gain wisdom through surrender and seeing things differently

reversed.meaning: You may be resisting necessary changes or sacrifices

13.name: Death
13.description: The veil or mask of life is perpetuated in change, transformation and passage from lower to higher. The mysterious horseman moves slowly, bearing a black banner emblazoned with the Mystic Rose, which signifies life. Between two pillars on the verge of the horizon there shines the sun of immortality. The horseman carries no visible weapon, but king and child and maiden fall before him, while a prelate with clasped hands awaits his end.
13.interpretation: End, mortality, destruction, corruption also, for a man, the loss of a benefactor for a woman, many contrarieties; for a maid, failure of marriage projects. Reversed: Inertia, sleep, lethargy, petrifaction, somnambulism; hope destroyed.

upright.behavior: Embracing change, letting go of the past
upright.meaning: A significant transformation or ending leads to new beginnings

reversed.meaning: You may be resisting necessary endings or changes
reversed.sexuality: Refusing to let go of past relationships

14.name: Temperance
14.description: A winged angel, with the sign of the sun upon his forehead and on his breast the square and triangle of the septenary. The figure is neither male nor female. It is held to be pouring the essences of life from chalice to chalice. It has one foot upon the earth and one upon waters, thus illustrating the nature of the essences.
14.interpretation: Economy, moderation, frugality, management, accommodation. Reversed: Things connected with churches, religions, sects, the priesthood, sometimes even the priest who will marry the Querent; also disunion, unfortunate combinations, competing interests.

upright.meaning: Find harmony through balance and patience

reversed.meaning: You may need to address imbalances or extreme behaviors
reversed.sexuality: Lack of balance in intimate matters

15.name: The Devil
15.description: The Horned Goat of Mendes, with wings like those of a bat, is standing on an altar. At the pit of the stomach there is the sign of Mercury. The right hand is upraised and extended, being the reverse of that benediction which is given by the Hierophant. In the left hand there is a great flaming torch, inverted towards the earth. A reversed pentagram is on the forehead.
15.interpretation: Ravage, violence, vehemence, extraordinary efforts, force, fatality; that which is predestined but is not for this reason evil. Reversed: Evil fatality, weakness, pettiness, blindness.

upright.meaning: You may be trapped by material desires or unhealthy attachments

reversed.meaning: Time to break free from limitations and unhealthy patterns

16.name: The Tower
16.description: Occult explanations attached to this card are meagre and mostly disconcerting. It depicts ruin in all its aspects. The Tower is literally the fall, when evil has prevailed therein, and above all that it is the rending of a House of Doctrine. It illustrates also in the most comprehensive way the old truth that 'except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it.'
16.interpretation: Misery, distress, indigence, adversity, calamity, disgrace, deception, ruin. It is a card in particular of unforeseen catastrophe. Reversed: According to one account, the same in a lesser degree also oppression, imprisonment, tyranny.

upright.meaning: Sudden changes bring necessary destruction for rebuilding

reversed.meaning: You may be avoiding necessary chaos or change

17.name: The Star
17.description: A great, radiant star of eight rays, surrounded by seven lesser stars--also of eight rays. The female figure in the foreground is entirely naked. Her left knee is on the land and her right foot upon the water. She pours Water of Life from two great ewers, irrigating sea and land. Behind her is rising ground and on the right a shrub or tree, whereon a bird alights. The figure expresses eternal youth and beauty.
17.interpretation: Loss, theft, privation, abandonment; another reading says-hope and bright prospects, Reversed: Arrogance, haughtiness, impotence.

upright.meaning: A period of hope and healing brings renewed faith

reversed.meaning: You may be losing hope or feeling disconnected
reversed.marriage: Need to restore hope and faith

18.name: The Moon
18.description: The moon is increasing on what is called the side of mercy, to the right of the observer. It has sixteen chief and sixteen secondary rays. The card represents life of the imagination apart from life of the spirit. The path between the towers is the issue into the unknown. The dog and wolf are the fears of the natural mind in the presence of that place of exit, when there is only reflected light to guide it.
18.interpretation: Hidden enemies, danger, calumny, darkness, terror, deception, occult forces, error. Reversed: Instability, inconstancy, silence, lesser degrees of deception and error.

upright.meaning: Navigate through uncertainty by trusting your intuition

reversed.meaning: Time to release fears and face reality

19.name: The Sun
19.description: The naked child mounted on a white horse and displaying a red standard has been mentioned already as the better symbolism connected with this card. It is the destiny of the Supernatural East and the great and holy light which goes before the endless procession of humanity, coming out from the walled garden of the sensitive life and passing on the journey home.
19.interpretation: Material happiness, fortunate marriage, contentment. Reversed: The same in a lesser sense.

upright.meaning: A period of joy and success brings warmth to your life

reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing temporary setbacks or negativity
reversed.marriage: Need to restore joy in partnership

20.name: Judgement
20.description: The great angel is here encompassed by clouds, but he blows his bannered trumpet, and the cross as usual is displayed on the banner. The dead are rising from their tombs--a woman on the right, a man on the left hand, and between them their child, whose back is turned. But in this card there are more than three who are restored, and it has been thought worth while to make this variation as illustrating the insufficiency of current explanations.
20.interpretation: Change of position, renewal, outcome. Another account specifies total loss though lawsuit. Reversed: Weakness, pusillanimity, simplicity; also deliberation, decision, sentence.

upright.meaning: A spiritual awakening or calling leads to renewal

reversed.meaning: You may be ignoring important calls or judgments

21.name: The World
21.description: As this final message of the Major Trumps is unchanged in respect of its design, it represents the perfection and end of the Cosmos, the secret which is within it, the rapture of the universe when it understands itself in God. It is further the state of the soul in the consciousness of Divine Vision, reflected from the self-knowing spirit.
21.interpretation: Assured success, recompense, voyage, route, emigration, flight, change of place. Reversed: Inertia, fixity, stagnation, permanence.

upright.meaning: A cycle completes bringing fulfillment and achievement

reversed.related: Incomplete, lack of closure, seeking more
reversed.meaning: You may need to complete unfinished business

22.name: Ace of Wands
22.description: A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.
22.interpretation: Creation, invention, enterprise, the powers which result in these; principle, beginning, source; birth, family, origin, and in a sense the virility which is behind them; the starting point of enterprises; according to another account, money, fortune, inheritance. Reversed: Fall, decadence, ruin, perdition, to perish also a certain clouded joy.

upright.meaning: A new creative venture or inspiration emerges

reversed.related: Delays, lack of motivation, false starts
reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing delays or lack of motivation

23.name: Two of Wands
23.description: A tall man looks from a battlemented roof over sea and shore; he holds a globe in his right hand, while a staff in his left rests on the battlement; another is fixed in a ring. The Rose and Cross and Lily should be noticed on the left side.
23.interpretation: Between the alternative readings there is no marriage possible; on the one hand, riches, fortune, magnificence; on the other, physical suffering, disease, chagrin, sadness, mortification. Reversed: Surprise, wonder, enchantment, emotion, trouble, fear.

upright.related: Planning, making decisions, leaving comfort zone
upright.meaning: Time to make decisions and plan your next move

reversed.related: Fear of change, bad planning, lack of direction
reversed.meaning: You may need to improve your planning or face your fears

24.name: Three of Wands
24.description: A calm, stately personage, with his back turned, looking from a cliff's edge at ships passing over the sea. Three staves are planted in the ground, and he leans slightly on one of them.
24.interpretation: He symbolizes established strength, enterprise, effort, trade, commerce, discovery; those are his ships, bearing his merchandise, which are sailing over the sea. Reversed: The end of troubles, suspension or cessation of adversity, toil and disappointment.

upright.meaning: Your plans are progressing, look for expansion opportunities

reversed.meaning: You may be experiencing delays or need to reassess your plans

25.name: Four of Wands
25.description: From the four great staves planted in the foreground there is a great garland suspended; two female figures uplift nosegays; at their side is a bridge over a moat, leading to an old manorial house.
25.interpretation: They are for once almost on the surface--country life, haven of refuge, a species of domestic harvest-home, repose, concord, harmony, prosperity, peace, and the perfected work of these. Reversed: The meaning remains unaltered; it is prosperity, increase, felicity, beauty, embellishment.

upright.meaning: A time of celebration and harmony in your home or community

reversed.meaning: You may need to address instability or lack of support

26.name: Five of Wands
26.description: A posse of youths, who are brandishing staves, as if in sport or strife.
26.interpretation: Imitation, as, for example, sham fight, but also the strenuous competition and struggle of the search after riches and fortune. In this sense it connects with the battle of life. Hence some attributions say that it is a card of gold, gain, opulence. Reversed: Litigation, disputes, trickery, contradiction.

upright.meaning: Competition or conflicts require your attention and energy

reversed.meaning: Time to resolve conflicts or avoid unnecessary competition

27.name: Six of Wands
27.description: A laurelled horseman bears one staff adorned with a laurel crown; footmen with staves are at his side.
27.interpretation: The card has been so designed that it can cover several significations; on the surface, it is a victor triumphing, but it is also great news, such as might be carried in state by the King's courier. Reversed: Apprehension, fear, as of a victorious enemy at the gate; treachery, disloyalty.

upright.meaning: Success and recognition are coming your way

reversed.related: Excess pride, lack of recognition, fall from grace
reversed.meaning: Be careful of pride or prepare for temporary setbacks

28.name: Seven of Wands
28.description: A young man on a craggy eminence brandishing a staff; six other staves are raised towards him from below.
28.interpretation: It is a card of valour, for, on the surface, six are attacking one, who has, however, the vantage position. On the intellectual plane, it signifies discussion, wordy strife; in business--negotiations, war of trade, barter, competition. Reversed: Perplexity, embarrassments, anxiety.

upright.meaning: Stand firm in your position and defend your achievements

reversed.meaning: You may be feeling overwhelmed or need to choose your battles

29.name: Eight of Wands
29.description: The card represents motion through the immovable-a flight of wands through an open country; but they draw to the term of their course. That which they signify is at hand; it may be even on the threshold.
29.interpretation: Activity in undertakings, the path of such activity, swiftness, as that of an express messenger; great haste, great hope, speed towards an end which promises assured felicity. Reversed: Arrows of jealousy, internal dispute, stingings of conscience, quarrels.

upright.meaning: Swift action and progress are coming your way

reversed.meaning: You may need to slow down or handle delays patiently

30.name: Nine of Wands
30.description: The figure leans upon his staff and has an expectant look, as if awaiting an enemy. Behind are eight other staves--erect, in orderly disposition, like a palisade.
30.interpretation: The card signifies strength in opposition. If attacked, the person will meet an onslaught boldly; and his build shews, that he may prove a formidable antagonist. Reversed: Obstacles, adversity, calamity.

upright.related: Resilience, courage, persistence, test of faith
upright.meaning: Stay resilient - you're almost at the finish line

reversed.meaning: You may need rest or to reassess your persistence

31.name: Ten of Wands
31.description: A man oppressed by the weight of the ten staves which he is carrying.
31.interpretation: A card of many significances, and some of the readings cannot be harmonized. The chief meaning is oppression simply, but it is also fortune, gain, any kind of success, and then it is the oppression of these things. Reversed: Contrarieties, difficulties, intrigues, and their analogies.

upright.meaning: You're carrying heavy burdens - consider sharing the load

reversed.meaning: Time to release burdens and delegate responsibilities

32.name: Page of Wands
32.description: In a scene similar to the former, a young man stands in the act of proclamation. He is unknown but faithful, and his tidings are strange.
32.interpretation: Dark young man, faithful, a lover, an envoy, a postman. Beside a man, he will bear favourable testimony concerning him. Has the chief qualities of his suit. Reversed: Anecdotes, announcements, evil news. Also indecision and the instability which accompanies it.

upright.meaning: A new creative phase or message brings excitement

reversed.meaning: You may need to focus your energy or overcome procrastination

33.name: Knight of Wands
33.description: He is shewn as if upon a journey, armed with a short wand, and although mailed is not on a warlike errand. He is passing mounds or pyramids. The motion of the horse is a key to the character of its rider, and suggests the precipitate mood, or things connected therewith.
33.interpretation: Departure, absence, flight, emigration. A dark young man, friendly. Change of residence. Reversed: Rupture, division, interruption, discord.

upright.meaning: Time for bold action and adventure

reversed.meaning: Be careful of impulsive actions or scattered energy

34.name: Queen of Wands
34.description: The Wands throughout this suit are always in leaf, as it is a suit of life and animation. Emotionally and otherwise, the Queen's personality corresponds to that of the King, but is more magnetic.
34.interpretation: A dark woman, countrywoman, friendly, chaste, loving, honourable. If the card beside her signifies a man, she is well disposed towards him; if a woman, she is interested in the Querent. Reversed: Good, economical, obliging, serviceable.

upright.meaning: Express your confidence and inspire others

reversed.meaning: Watch for jealousy or demanding behavior

35.name: King of Wands
35.description: The physical and emotional nature to which this card is attributed is dark, ardent, lithe, animated, impassioned, noble. The King uplifts a flowering wand, and wears, like his three correspondences in the remaining suits, what is called a cap of maintenance beneath his crown. He connects with the symbol of the lion, which is emblazoned on the back of his throne.
35.interpretation: Dark man, friendly, countryman, generally married, honest and conscientious. The card always signifies honesty, and may mean news concerning an unexpected heritage to fall in before very long. Reversed: Good, but severe; austere, yet tolerant.

upright.meaning: Time to take leadership and pursue your vision

reversed.meaning: Be careful of hasty decisions or ruthless behavior

36.name: Ace of Cups
36.description: The waters are beneath, and thereon are water-lilies; the hand issues from the cloud, holding in its palm the cup, from which four streams are pouring; a dove, bearing in its bill a cross-marked Host, descends to place the Wafer in the Cup; the dew of water is falling on all sides.
36.interpretation: House of the true heart, joy, content, abode, nourishment, abundance, fertility; Holy Table, felicity hereof. Reversed: House of the false heart, mutation, instability, revolution.

upright.meaning: A new emotional beginning or relationship is emerging

reversed.meaning: You may be blocking emotions or experiencing loss

37.name: Two of Cups
37.description: A youth and maiden are pledging one another, and above their cups rises the Caduceus of Hermes, between the great wings of which there appears a lion's head. It is a variant of a sign which is found in a few old examples of this card.
37.interpretation: Love, passion, friendship, affinity, union, concord, sympathy, the interrelation of the sexes, and--as a suggestion apart from all offices of divination--that desire which is not in Nature, but by which Nature is sanctified.

upright.meaning: A meaningful partnership or connection is forming

reversed.meaning: Relationship tensions or separations may need attention

38.name: Three of Cups
38.description: Maidens in a garden-ground with cups uplifted, as if pledging one another.
38.interpretation: The conclusion of any matter in plenty, perfection and merriment; happy issue, victory, fulfilment, solace, healing. Reversed: Expedition, dispatch, achievement, end. It signifies also the side of excess in physical enjoyment, and the pleasures of the senses.

upright.meaning: Time for celebration and enjoying friendships

reversed.meaning: Watch for excess or negative social influences

39.name: Four of Cups
39.description: A young man is seated under a tree and contemplates three cups set on the grass before him; an arm issuing from a cloud offers him another cup. His expression notwithstanding is one of discontent with his environment.
39.interpretation: Weariness, disgust, aversion, imaginary vexations, as if the wine of this world had caused satiety only; another wine, as if a fairy gift, is now offered the wastrel, but he sees no consolation therein. Reversed: Novelty, presage, new instruction, new relations.

upright.meaning: Time to reevaluate and notice opportunities around you

reversed.meaning: Opening up to new opportunities and possibilities

40.name: Five of Cups
40.description: A dark, cloaked figure, looking sideways at three prone cups two others stand upright behind him; a bridge is in the background, leading to a small keep or holding.
40.interpretation: It is a card of loss, but something remains over; three have been taken, but two are left; it is a card of inheritance, patrimony, transmission, but not corresponding to expectations. Reversed: News, alliances, affinity, consanguinity, ancestry, return, false projects.

upright.meaning: Focus on what remains rather than what's lost

reversed.meaning: Time to heal and move forward from past hurts

41.name: Six of Cups
41.description: Children in an old garden, their cups filled with flowers.
41.interpretation: A card of the past and of memories, looking back, as--for example--on childhood; happiness, enjoyment, but coming rather from the past; things that have vanished. Reversed: The future, renewal, that which will come to pass presently.

upright.meaning: Past connections or memories bring joy

reversed.related: Living in past, moving forward, leaving home
reversed.behavior: Letting go of past, moving forward
reversed.meaning: Time to move forward rather than dwelling in the past

42.name: Seven of Cups
42.description: Strange chalices of vision, but the images are more especially those of the fantastic spirit.
42.interpretation: Fairy favours, images of reflection, sentiment, imagination, things seen in the glass of contemplation; some attainment in these degrees, but nothing permanent or substantial is suggested. Reversed: Desire, will, determination, project.

upright.meaning: Many choices available but beware of illusions

reversed.meaning: Time to focus and make realistic choices

43.name: Eight of Cups
43.description: A man of dejected aspect is deserting the cups of his felicity, enterprise, undertaking or previous concern.
43.interpretation: The card speaks for itself on the surface, but other readings are entirely antithetical--giving joy, mildness, timidity, honour, modesty. In practice, it is usually found that the card shews the decline of a matter. Reversed: Great joy, happiness, feasting.

upright.meaning: Time to move on from what no longer serves you

reversed.related: Confusion, fear of change, aimless drifting
reversed.behavior: Staying in comfort zone, fearing change
reversed.meaning: You may be avoiding necessary changes

44.name: Nine of Cups
44.description: A goodly personage has feasted to his heart's content, and abundant refreshment of wine is on the arched counter behind him, seeming to indicate that the future is also assured. The picture offers the material side only, but there are other aspects.
44.interpretation: Concord, contentment, physical bien-etre; also victory, success, advantage; satisfaction for the Querent or person for whom the consultation is made. Reversed: Truth, loyalty, liberty; but the readings vary and include mistakes, imperfections, etc.

upright.meaning: Your wishes are being fulfilled, enjoy the contentment

reversed.meaning: Look within for true happiness

45.name: Ten of Cups
45.description: Appearance of Cups in a rainbow; it is contemplated in wonder and ecstacy by a man and woman below, evidently husband and wife. His right arm is about her; his left is raised upward; she raises her right arm. The two children dancing near them have not observed the prodigy but are happy after their own manner. There is a home-scene beyond.
45.interpretation: Contentment, repose of the entire heart; the perfection of that state; also perfection of human love and friendship. Reversed: Repose of the false heart, indignation, violence.

upright.meaning: Complete emotional fulfillment and harmony

reversed.meaning: Family or relationship issues need attention

46.name: Page of Cups
46.description: A fair, pleasing, somewhat effeminate page, of studious and intent aspect, contemplates a fish rising from a cup to look at him. It is the pictures of the mind taking form.
46.interpretation: Fair young man, one impelled to render service and with whom the Querent will be connected; a studious youth; news, message; application, reflection, meditation. Reversed: Taste, inclination, attachment, seduction, artifice.

upright.meaning: New emotional phase or creative inspiration begins

reversed.meaning: Need to mature emotionally or unblock creativity

47.name: Knight of Cups
47.description: Graceful, but not warlike; riding quietly, wearing a winged helmet, referring to those higher graces of the imagination which sometimes characterize this card. He too is a dreamer, but the images of the side of sense haunt him in his vision.
47.interpretation: Arrival, approach--sometimes that of a messenger; advances, proposition, demeanour, invitation, incitement. Reversed: Trickery, artifice, subtlety, swindling, duplicity, fraud.

upright.meaning: A romantic opportunity or creative pursuit arrives

reversed.meaning: Be careful of emotional manipulation or unrealistic dreams

48.name: Queen of Cups
48.description: Beautiful, fair, dreamy--as one who sees visions in a cup. This is, however, only one of her aspects; she sees, but she also acts, and her activity feeds her dream.
48.interpretation: Good, fair woman; honest, devoted woman, who will do service to the Querent; loving intelligence, and hence the gift of vision; success, happiness, pleasure; also wisdom, virtue. Reversed: The accounts vary; good woman; otherwise, distinguished woman but one not to be trusted; perverse woman; vice, dishonour, depravity.

upright.meaning: Trust your intuition and show compassion

reversed.meaning: Watch for emotional manipulation or codependency

49.name: King of Cups
49.description: He holds a short sceptre in his left hand and a great cup in his right; his throne is set upon the sea; on one side a ship is riding and on the other a dolphin is leaping. The implicit is that the Sign of the Cup naturally refers to water, which appears in all the court cards.
49.interpretation: Fair man, man of business, law, or divinity; responsible, disposed to oblige the Querent; also equity, art and science, including those who profess science, law and art; creative intelligence. Reversed: Dishonest, double-dealing man; roguery, exaction, injustice, vice, scandal.

upright.meaning: Master your emotions and show diplomatic leadership

reversed.meaning: Be careful of emotional manipulation or volatility

50.name: Ace of Swords
50.description: A hand issues from a cloud, grasping as word, the point of which is encircled by a crown.
50.interpretation: Triumph, the excessive degree in everything, conquest, triumph of force. It is a card of great force, in love as well as in hatred. Reversed: The same, but the results are disastrous; another account says--conception, childbirth, augmentation, multiplicity.

upright.meaning: A moment of clarity or truth brings breakthrough

reversed.meaning: Mental confusion or harsh words may cause problems

51.name: Two of Swords
51.description: A hoodwinked female figure balances two swords upon her shoulders.
51.interpretation: Conformity and the equipoise which it suggests, courage, friendship, concord in a state of arms; another reading gives tenderness, affection, intimacy. Reversed: Imposture, falsehood, duplicity, disloyalty.

upright.meaning: Time to face a difficult decision or truth

reversed.meaning: Release mental blocks and make necessary decisions

52.name: Three of Swords
52.description: Three swords piercing a heart; cloud and rain behind.
52.interpretation: Removal, absence, delay, division, rupture, dispersion, and all that the design signifies naturally, being too simple and obvious to call for specific enumeration. Reversed: Mental alienation, error, loss, distraction, disorder, confusion.

upright.meaning: A painful truth or heartbreak needs to be faced

reversed.meaning: Time to heal from past hurts and forgive

53.name: Four of Swords
53.description: The effigy of a knight in the attitude of prayer, at full length upon his tomb.
53.interpretation: Vigilance, retreat, solitude, hermit's repose, exile, tomb and coffin. It is these last that have suggested the design. Reversed: Wise administration, circumspection, economy, avarice, precaution, testament.

upright.meaning: Take time for rest and mental recovery

reversed.meaning: Need for rest and recovery is becoming urgent

54.name: Five of Swords
54.description: A disdainful man looks after two retreating and dejected figures. Their swords lie upon the ground. He carries two others on his left shoulder, and a third sword is in his right hand, point to earth. He is the master in possession of the field.
54.interpretation: Degradation, destruction, revocation, infamy, dishonour, loss, with the variants and analogues of these. Reversed: The same; burial and obsequies.

upright.related: Conflict, defeat, win at all costs, hostility
upright.meaning: Consider if winning at all costs is worth it

reversed.meaning: Time to reconcile and move past conflicts

55.name: Six of Swords
55.description: A ferryman carrying passengers in his punt to the further shore. The course is smooth, and seeing that the freight is light, it may be noted that the work is not beyond his strength.
55.interpretation: Journey by water, route, way, envoy, commissionary, expedient. Reversed: Declaration, confession, publicity; one account says that it is a proposal of love.

upright.behavior: Moving away from trouble, seeking peace
upright.meaning: Moving toward calmer waters and better times

reversed.meaning: You may be resisting necessary transitions

56.name: Seven of Swords
56.description: A man in the act of carrying away five swords rapidly; the two others of the card remain stuck in the ground. A camp is close at hand.
56.interpretation: Design, attempt, wish, hope, confidence; also quarrelling, a plan that may fail, annoyance. The design is uncertain in its import, because the significations are widely at variance with each other. Reversed: Good advice, counsel, instruction, slander, babbling.

upright.meaning: Be careful of deception or strategic withdrawal

reversed.meaning: Time for honesty and facing the truth

57.name: Eight of Swords
57.description: A woman, bound and hoodwinked, with the swords of the card about her. Yet it is rather a card of temporary durance than of irretrievable bondage.
57.interpretation: Bad news, violent chagrin, crisis, censure, power in trammels, conflict, calumny; also sickness. Reversed: Disquiet, difficulty, opposition, accident, treachery; what is unforeseen; fatality.

upright.meaning: You may be trapped by your own thoughts

reversed.meaning: Time to break free from mental restrictions

58.name: Nine of Swords
58.description: One seated on her couch in lamentation, with the swords over her. She is as one who knows no sorrow which is like unto hers. It is a card of utter desolation.
58.interpretation: Death, failure, miscarriage, delay, deception, disappointment, despair. Reversed: Imprisonment, suspicion, doubt, reasonable fear, shame.

upright.meaning: Mental anxiety and worries need addressing

reversed.meaning: Light at the end of the tunnel is appearing

59.name: Ten of Swords
59.description: A prostrate figure, pierced by all the swords belonging to the card.
59.interpretation: Whatsoever is intimated by the design; also pain, affliction, tears, sadness, desolation. It is not especially a card of violent death. Reversed: Advantage, profit, success, favour, but none of these are permanent; also power and authority.

upright.meaning: A difficult situation reaches its conclusion

reversed.meaning: Time for healing and accepting endings

60.name: Page of Swords
60.description: A lithe, active figure holds a sword upright in both hands, while in the act of swift walking. He is passing over rugged land, and about his way the clouds are collocated wildly. He is alert and lithe, looking this way and that, as if an expected enemy might appear at any moment.
60.interpretation: Authority, overseeing, secret service, vigilance, spying, examination, and the qualities thereto belonging. Reversed: More evil side of these qualities; what is unforeseen, unprepared state; sickness is also intimated.

upright.meaning: New information or truth comes to light

reversed.meaning: Be careful with communications and stay focused

61.name: Knight of Swords
61.description: He is riding in full course, as if scattering his enemies. In the design he is really a prototypical hero of romantic chivalry. He might almost be Galahad, whose sword is swift and sure because he is clean of heart.
61.interpretation: Skill, bravery, capacity, defence, address, enmity, wrath, war, destruction, opposition, resistance, ruin. There is therefore a sense in which the card signifies death, but it carries this meaning only in its proximity to other cards of fatality. Reversed: Imprudence, incapacity, extravagance.

upright.meaning: Time for bold action and adventure

reversed.meaning: Be careful of impulsive actions or scattered energy

62.name: Queen of Swords
62.description: Her right hand raises the weapon vertically and the hilt rests on an arm of her royal chair the left hand is extended, the arm raised her countenance is severe but chastened; it suggests familiarity with sorrow. It does not represent mercy, and, her sword notwithstanding, she is scarcely a symbol of power.
62.interpretation: Widowhood, female sadness and embarrassment, absence, sterility, mourning, privation, separation. Reversed: Malice, bigotry, artifice, prudery, bale, deceit.

upright.meaning: Use clear judgment and direct communication

reversed.meaning: Watch for excessive criticism or bitterness

63.name: King of Swords
63.description: He sits in judgment, holding the unsheathed sign of his suit. He recalls, of course, the conventional Symbol of justice in the Trumps Major, and he may represent this virtue, but he is rather the power of life and death, in virtue of his office.
63.interpretation: Whatsoever arises out of the idea of judgment and all its connexions-power, command, authority, militant intelligence, law, offices of the crown, and so forth. Reversed: Cruelty, perversity, barbarity, perfidy, evil intention.

upright.meaning: Lead with clear thinking and ethical authority

reversed.meaning: Be careful of intellectual tyranny

64.name: Ace of Pentacles
64.description: A hand--issuing, as usual, from a cloud--holds up a pentacle.
64.interpretation: Perfect contentment, felicity, ecstasy; also speedy intelligence; gold. Reversed: The evil side of wealth, bad intelligence; also great riches. In any case it shews prosperity, comfortable material conditions, but whether these are of advantage to the possessor will depend on whether the card is reversed or not.

upright.meaning: A new material opportunity or beginning arrives

reversed.related: Lost opportunity, lack of planning, greed
reversed.meaning: Missed opportunities need better planning

65.name: Two of Pentacles
65.description: A young man, in the act of dancing, has a pentacle in either hand, and they are joined by that endless cord which is like the number 8 reversed.
65.interpretation: On the one hand it is represented as a card of gaiety, recreation and its connexions, which is the subject of the design; but it is read also as news and messages in writing, as obstacles, agitation, trouble, embroilment. Reversed: Enforced gaiety, simulated enjoyment, literal sense, handwriting, composition, letters of exchange.

upright.meaning: Balance multiple responsibilities with flexibility

reversed.meaning: Need to restore balance and organization

66.name: Three of Pentacles
66.description: A sculptor at his work in a monastery. Compare the design which illustrates the Eight of Pentacles. The apprentice or amateur therein has received his reward and is now at work in earnest.
66.interpretation: Metier, trade, skilled labour; usually, however, regarded as a card of nobility, aristocracy, renown, glory. Reversed: Mediocrity, in work and otherwise, puerility, pettiness, weakness.

upright.meaning: Success through collaboration and skill development

reversed.meaning: Need for better collaboration and skill development

67.name: Four of Pentacles
67.description: A crowned figure, having a pentacle over his crown, clasps another with hands and arms; two pentacles are under his feet. He holds to that which he has.
67.interpretation: The surety of possessions, cleaving to that which one has, gift, legacy, inheritance. Reversed: Suspense, delay, opposition.

upright.meaning: Focus on security but don't be too rigid

reversed.meaning: Time to release material attachments

68.name: Five of Pentacles
68.description: Two mendicants in a snow-storm pass a lighted casement.
68.interpretation: The card foretells material trouble above all, whether in the form illustrated--that is, destitution--or otherwise. For some cartomancists, it is a card of love and lovers-wife, husband, friend, mistress; also concordance, affinities. Reversed: Disorder, chaos, ruin, discord, profligacy.

upright.meaning: Material difficulties require faith and support

reversed.related: Recovery, spiritual growth, asking for help
reversed.meaning: Recovery from difficulties is coming

69.name: Six of Pentacles
69.description: A person in the guise of a merchant weighs money in a pair of scales and distributes it to the needy and distressed. It is a testimony to his own success in life, as well as to his goodness of heart.
69.interpretation: Presents, gifts, gratification another account says attention, vigilance now is the accepted time, present prosperity, etc. Reversed: Desire, cupidity, envy, jealousy, illusion.

upright.meaning: A time of giving or receiving help and resources

reversed.meaning: Watch for power imbalances in giving/receiving

70.name: Seven of Pentacles
70.description: A young man, leaning on his staff, looks intently at seven pentacles attached to a clump of greenery on his right; one would say that these were his treasures and that his heart was there.
70.interpretation: These are exceedingly contradictory; in the main, it is a card of money, business, barter; but one reading gives altercation, quarrels--and another innocence, ingenuity, purgation. Reversed: Cause for anxiety regarding money which it may be proposed to lend.

upright.meaning: Time to evaluate long-term investments

reversed.meaning: Impatience may lead to poor results

71.name: Eight of Pentacles
71.description: An artist in stone at his work, which he exhibits in the form of trophies.
71.interpretation: Work, employment, commission, craftsmanship, skill in craft and business, perhaps in the preparatory stage. Reversed: Voided ambition, vanity, cupidity, exaction, usury. It may also signify the possession of skill, in the sense of the ingenious mind turned to cunning and intrigue.

upright.meaning: Focus on developing skills and craftsmanship

reversed.meaning: Avoid perfectionism and shortcuts

72.name: Nine of Pentacles
72.description: A woman, with a bird upon her wrist, stands amidst a great abundance of grapevines in the garden of a manorial house. It is a wide domain, suggesting plenty in all things. Possibly it is her own possession and testifies to material well-being.
72.interpretation: Prudence, safety, success, accomplishment, certitude, discernment. Reversed: Roguery, deception, voided project, bad faith.

upright.meaning: Enjoy the fruits of your independent work

reversed.meaning: Watch for excessive materialism or dependence

73.name: Ten of Pentacles
73.description: A man and woman beneath an archway which gives entrance to a house and domain. They are accompanied by a child, who looks curiously at two dogs accosting an ancient personage seated in the foreground. The child's hand is on one of them.
73.interpretation: Gain, riches; family matters, archives, extraction, the abode of a family. Reversed: Chance, fatality, loss, robbery, games of hazard; sometimes gift, dowry, pension.

upright.meaning: Long-term security and family wealth achieved

reversed.meaning: Family or financial foundations need attention

74.name: Page of Pentacles
74.description: A youthful figure, looking intently at the pentacle which hovers over his raised hands. He moves slowly, insensible of that which is about him.
74.interpretation: Application, study, scholarship, reflection another reading says news, messages and the bringer thereof; also rule, management. Reversed: Prodigality, dissipation, liberality, luxury; unfavourable news.

upright.meaning: New financial or educational opportunity begins

reversed.meaning: Need to focus on practical matters

75.name: Knight of Pentacles
75.description: He rides a slow, enduring, heavy horse, to which his own aspect corresponds. He exhibits his symbol, but does not look therein.
75.interpretation: Utility, serviceableness, interest, responsibility, rectitude-all on the normal and external plane. Reversed: inertia, idleness, repose of that kind, stagnation; also placidity, discouragement, carelessness.

upright.meaning: Steady progress through reliable effort

reversed.meaning: Don't let perfectionism halt progress

76.name: Queen of Pentacles
76.description: The face suggests that of a dark woman, whose qualities might be summed up in the idea of greatness of soul; she has also the serious cast of intelligence; she contemplates her symbol and may see worlds therein.
76.interpretation: Opulence, generosity, magnificence, security, liberty. Reversed: Evil, suspicion, suspense, fear, mistrust.

upright.meaning: Practical nurturing brings material success

reversed.meaning: Watch for excessive materialism or self-neglect

77.name: King of Pentacles
77.description: The figure calls for no special description the face is rather dark, suggesting also courage, but somewhat lethargic in tendency. The bull's head should be noted as a recurrent symbol on the throne. The sign of this suit is represented throughout as engraved or blazoned with the pentagram, typifying the correspondence of the four elements in human nature and that by which they may be governed.
77.interpretation: Valour, realizing intelligence, business and normal intellectual aptitude, sometimes mathematical gifts and attainments of this kind; success in these paths. Reversed: Vice, weakness, ugliness, perversity, corruption, peril.

upright.meaning: Success through practical leadership

reversed.meaning: Watch for greed or poor financial choices
